image.altText: A large man wearing a grey suit speaks as he is surrounded by reporters holding microphones

props.synopsis: With Jarryd Hayne now out of jail following his sexual assault conviction being overturned, experts and advocates question whether the state's justice system is fit for purpose when it comes to sexual assault cases.

title.children: Why experts believe legal system is 'untenable' for sexual assault cases after Hayne verdict

image.altText: A crumbling staircase underneath a beachside house.

props.synopsis: Beaches around Australia are at risk of disappearing. As climate change brings about more severe storms and the sea level rises, many communities are looking to solutions such as sand nourishment to address the issue.

title.children: Communities are crying out for help to protect their coastlines. Sand nourishment is one solution being considered

image.altText: Offshore wind turbines in the ocean, with a blue sky overhead.

props.synopsis: The federal government has given the green light to a fourth offshore wind zone, located off the Illawarra coast, with a reduced size, following community concerns.

title.children: Government approves smaller offshore wind zone off Illawarra

props.synopsis: Princess Catherine, who has been receiving preventative chemotherapy for cancer, says she will "join a few public engagements over summer", including Trooping the Colour in London on Saturday.

title.children: 'There are good days and bad days': Kate Middleton to make first public appearance as chemo continues

image.altText: a woman is sitting at a table looking at a utility bill.

props.synopsis: Across Australia, a huge, forced migration is underway as consumers are shunted on to complex power prices. Just don't expect anyone to tell you about it.

title.children: A rude bill shock was the first most households heard about this monumental shift in Australia's energy system

image.altText: Man stands amid protestors wearing a sign: "UK rich state, mass, fuel, poverty, and Tory, austerity, end it now.

props.synopsis: When the Conservatives took power in Britain 14 years ago, they took a butcher's knife to budget spending. It was designed to save the country, but did it break it instead?

title.children: The UK is poorer, sicker and more unsafe. Did the Conservatives break Britain?

image.altText: Three author head shots including David Nicholls, Samantha Shannon and Elizabeth Acevedo

props.synopsis: Some of the biggest names in publishing are sitting down with RN to talk all things literary for the Big Weekend of Books. Follow our live blog for all the highlights from our jam-packed schedule.

title.children: The Big Weekend of Books is here! Join us as David Nicholls, Samantha Shannon and more chat all things literary

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Andrew O'Hagan on how London fascinates and repulses him — at the same time
Sophie Elmhirst on what becoming shipwrecked does to a marriage
David Nicholls on why he wrote a love story set in the middle of nowhere

image.altText: MQ-4C Triton Unmanned Aircraft System

props.synopsis: The first of at least four new large, unmanned surveillance aircraft is due to arrive in the Northern Territory today. It will play a key role in monitoring unauthorised maritime arrivals.

title.children: Long-range surveillance drone headed for Australia to monitor unauthorised boat arrivals

image.altText: Ed Le Brocq, smiling with arms crossed across chest, with black rimmed glasses, stands before large portrait of him as centaur.

props.synopsis: Centaurs can represent wisdom and knowledge. Jaq Grantford's portrait of Ed Le Brocq as a centaur tells the story of personal transformation.

title.children: Centaurs are transitional beings. One in particular captures ABC Classic's Ed Le Brocq's journey

image.altText: A teenage girl with blonde hair holds a mobile phone with both hands, with the phone in focus and her face obscured.

props.synopsis: Experts say sexual abuse using deepfake porn is likely to get worse, and it's not just AI sophistication that's enabling the behaviour. Exposure to misogynistic messages and degrading content online is "crushing" the empathy of young people.

title.children: How we've gone from a revival of 'make me a sandwich' jokes to a new era of AI 'revenge porn'

image.altText: Graphic of Australian bank logos balancing on top of each other.

props.synopsis: Banks will need to tell customers when their savings interest rate changes, and the process for switching home loans will be simplified under a new federal government push to help consumers get better deals.

title.children: Government to 'nudge' banks to level with their customers on how to get a better deal

image.altText: A mine near Broken Hill at sunset with the horizon and the city.

props.synopsis: A stargazing tourism operation says it has "legalled up" in response to a billion-dollar renewable energy project set to be located down the road from the business that relies on dark skies.

title.children: Astronomy tourism business ready to fight Australia's first compressed air energy storage project

image.altText: A composite image has Dermot Dann and Daniel Porceddu side-by-side, dressed in formal court attire.

props.synopsis: It's murder or acquittal — after five weeks of evidence and arguments, the jury in Greg Lynn's murder trial over the deaths of two Victorian campers only have two options to choose from.

title.children: Insults fly in the courtroom as Greg Lynn's double-murder trial nears its final chapter

image.altText: A composite image of close up shots of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton.

props.synopsis: The recent political debates have seen Peter Dutton set the rules of play — it's a strategy that Anthony Albanese will need to counteract quickly to avoid trouble.

title.children: If Albanese doesn't move quickly, Dutton will continue to set the rules of play in political debate

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie stands behind a bank of microphones speaking at a press conference

props.synopsis: Officials, diplomats and police in Canberra are furiously preparing for Chinese Premier Li Qiang, who will fly into Australia later today at a crucial time for Beijing and the Australian government.

title.children: China Premier to visit Australia today for the first time in seven years

image.altText: A black bear sits in a cage rattling the fence.

props.synopsis: Japan recorded 219 bear attacks on people in the 12-months leading up to March this year, including six fatalities. The situation is becoming so severe that government officials have warned some bears are viewing humans as prey.

title.children: 'The bears know humans are present': How Japan's black bears became a deadly problem

image.altText: An aerial shot of a tropical blue lagoon, with beachfront bungalows, resorts and yachts.

props.synopsis: The Maldivian government says controversial land reclamation projects are necessary to fight rising sea levels and land scarcity. Experts say tourism is trumping the environment.

title.children: The Maldives is building new islands to fend off rising seas — and environmentalists are outraged

image.altText: Former 2Day FM radio presenter, Mel Greig who was part of the duo who made the infamous royal prank call in 2012.

props.synopsis: In 2012, radio host Mel Greig made a royal prank call that shocked the world. One woman took her own life; another is haunted to this day. How did the joke go so wrong?

title.children: Mel made a prank call to a hospital where Kate Middleton was a patient. The nurse who answered ended up dead

image.altText: A line of crosses in red dirt

props.synopsis: The ban was imposed after a bump stock, which allows a gun to fire at a similar speed to an automatic weapon, was used in a deadly mass shooting in Las Vegas in 2017.

title.children: US Supreme Court overturns Trump-era ban on rapid-fire gun accessory

image.altText: Woman holding black phone receiver looking at camera.

props.synopsis: Mary Bradley came out of retirement to help women escape abusive relationships. She says most people wouldn't realise domestic violence is "in their backyard".

title.children: Mary, 70, helps women leave violent partners. This is what she has learned

image.altText: a woman in a wetsuit holds up a surfboard in water

props.synopsis: After a divorce, single mum Fran saved for 13 years to buy a home on Sydney's Northern Beaches, now she's worried her children will never get the chance.

title.children: Housing crisis is separating families, and experts warn little can be done in the short term

image.altText: A head shot of John Bath

props.synopsis: Better Renting executive director Joel Dingham says sometimes even mentioning the prospect of going to tribunal can bring about a resolution.

title.children: John was told his rent was going up by $200. Then the eviction notice came

image.altText: Cate Campbell holds her hands together

props.synopsis: Cate Campbell's 16-year Olympic career could come to an end unless she pulls one last miracle swim out of the bag.

title.children: Cate Campbell's 25 seconds of truth as Olympic dreams hang in the balance

image.altText: USA players embrace as they celebrate defeating Pakistan at the men's T20 World Cup.

props.synopsis: On debut at the men's T20 World Cup, co-hosts United States advance to the Super Eight stage, while former champions Pakistan bow out of contention.

title.children: US makes T20 World Cup history, Pakistan fails to advance from group stage

image.altText: Image of thylacine yawning with colours blue, green and sandy brown dirt added.

props.synopsis: Biotechnology company Colossal Biosciences says the Tasmanian tiger will return within the decade and it's laying the groundwork for the species' re-emergence.

title.children: Tassie wildlife sanctuary forms 'partnership of possibilities' with company aiming to bring thylacine back to life

image.altText: Dustin Martin of Richmond pumps his fist and looks skywards.

props.synopsis: Dustin Martin, the man who was drafted to Richmond at its lowest ebb and hauled the club to three premierships, plays his 300th game on Saturday night. In an astonishing career, where does he sit among the modern greats?

title.children: Dustin Martin's on-field alchemy makes him an unparalleled champion of AFL

image.altText: A woman with blond hair in pink shirt and blazer

props.synopsis: The federal seat of North Sydney is set to be scrapped under new draft boundaries proposed by the Australian Electoral Commission.

title.children: 'I don't know': Tink undecided if she'll challenge a neighbouring teal with North Sydney facing axe

image.altText: A man in a grey suit and glasses looks downcast, eyes down, serious woman with sunglasses next to him. Tree in the background.

props.synopsis: Senior constable Tom Harper pleaded guilty to not performing a proper random breath test on someone he knew.

title.children: No conviction for police officer over 'very poor' decision to fake random breath test

image.altText: Payne Haas looks dejected, surrounded by teammates, after the Brisbane Broncos concede a try

props.synopsis: Latrell Mitchell has made a compelling case for a NSW State of Origin recall, starring as South Sydney made it three straight wins with a 22-12 defeat of Brisbane.

title.children: 'Forgotten how to hold the ball': Woeful Broncos slump to third straight loss as Latrell Mitchell makes Origin case

image.altText: A Brisbane Lions AFL player grins with his tongue out as he celebrates during a game.

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Lions are within striking distance of the top eight after posting two wins on the trot with a 20-point triumph over St Kilda at the Gabba.

title.children: 'Bold and fearless': How the Lions plan to make finals as mid-season surge continues

image.altText: A man viewed through a partially open door.

props.synopsis: State and territory hospital funding negotiations are on pause according to the federal health minister in an effort to focus on the overhaul of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS), despite public hospitals being under pressure.

title.children: States and territories receive hospital funding negotiation pause to 'catch up' on NDIS reform

image.altText: a teenager approaches Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel 150424 at wakeley

props.synopsis: A teenager charged with a terror offence over the alleged stabbing of a bishop at a south-west Sydney church is charged with additional offences.

title.children: Teen accused of Sydney terror attack hit with new charges as more riot arrests made

image.altText: Shayna Jack and Mollie O'Callaghan react in the pool after a race

props.synopsis: A defiant Mollie O'Callaghan and an overjoyed Shayna Jack book their spots in a dramatic 100m freestyle final at the Australian Swimming Trials.

title.children: O'Callaghan, Jack claim coveted individual spots in 100 metre freestyle, fresh faces feature in Paralympic team

image.altText: Sophia Huang Xueqin

props.synopsis: Human rights groups call for the immediate release of journalist Sophia Huang Xueqin and labour activist Wang Jianbing, saying they've been imprisoned for exercising their right to free speech.

title.children: 'Malicious and groundless': Leading Chinese #MeToo journalist jailed in China for inciting subversion

image.altText: Supreme Court justices sitting and standing in black robes in official portrait.

props.synopsis: For the first time since his supporters stormed the Capitol on January 6, Donald Trump returned to meet Republican politicians. The Supreme Court had just given them something to talk about.

title.children: America's Supreme Court just took some heat out of a fight that could have been hard for Trump to win
